{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["age", "medium", "21 is in high-risk age range but not extreme"],
    ["gender", "high", "being male significantly increases risk based on examples"],
    ["race", "low", "being White shows mixed outcomes in examples"],
    ["prior arrests", "medium", "2 arrests is moderate, higher than some but lower than high-risk cases"],
    ["conviction status", "medium", "being convicted shows slightly higher risk in examples"],
    ["physical attributes", "low", "height/weight show no clear pattern in examples"],
    ["marital/living status", "medium", "living alone appears as risk factor in several cases"],
    ["education", "low", "having high school diploma is protective factor"],
    ["employment", "low", "3 jobs shows stability and is protective"],
    ["drug use", "high", "use of both marijuana and cocaine appears in several recidivist cases"],
    ["mental health", "low", "no depression is protective"],
    ["childhood household", "medium", "single mother household shows mixed outcomes"],
    ["religious belief", "low", "belief in God's influence shows mixed outcomes"]
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: 21 is in high-risk age range but not extreme
being male significantly increases risk based on examples
being White shows mixed outcomes in examples
2 arrests is moderate, higher than some but lower than high-risk cases
being convicted shows slightly higher risk in examples
height/weight show no clear pattern in examples
living alone appears as risk factor in several cases
having high school diploma is protective factor
3 jobs shows stability and is protective
use of both marijuana and cocaine appears in several recidivist cases
single mother household shows mixed outcomes
belief in God's influence shows mixed outcomes

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. First,analyze the following example cases of risk factors and resulting 3 year rearrest recidivism outcome:

Example #1:
Risk Factors: The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 7 times and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 4 inches and weighs 130 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He does not have a high school diploma or GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 4. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: YES

Example #2:
Risk Factors: The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 1 time and has been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs between 175 and 199 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a GED certificate and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana and cocaine) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with his biological mother in a household of size 6, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.
Outcome: NO

He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and most of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up.
